name: St. Odilo of Cluny
summary: Odilo was the fifth abbot of Cluny, serving from 994 to 1049. Under his leadership, Cluny continued to grow in influence and power, with hundreds of monasteries coming under its authority. He is credited with establishing All Souls' Day (November 2) as a day of prayer for the dead throughout the Church. He was a key figure in the Cluniac reform movement and worked to strengthen monastic discipline and liturgical observance. He was canonized in 1063.
